intro: Ancistrocarphus filagineus, commonly known as the silky sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a silky appearance. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
